page.title: 19ACID RAIN
page.content: { Acid rain}is one of the major environmental issues in this area.It is caused by{pollution}from power stations,factories and cars. They emit SO2 and NO2 which are absorbed by rain and this falls as dilute sulphuric acid or acid rain. The problem is made even worse in this area by{high rainfall,rock type and{large forest areas. The rock is mainly{granite}covered with peat.Peaty soil is slightly acidic and contains little{calcium}so it cannot neutralise the acid rain. Granite is non_porous and cannot absorb the rain,so it filters down into lochs and rivers. Large forest areas in Galloway are a problem.Experiments on Scots Pine have shown acidity can be increased {ten times}by the time it has run through the needles and down the bark.
